results.title: The Ferrara poems
results.creator_credit: Jenny Robertson, Australian Film Commission and S A Department for the Arts
results.brief_description: Two Australian travellers Karl (Michael Snelling) and Giselle (Kerin Murray) meet up with friends at a cafe in Italy for coffee and discuss their cultural experiences and observations of the country. A trip is planned and the group sets off together on another sight-seeing adventure. A postmodernist film essay exploring the structure of storytelling through the deliberate raw use of cinematic and film making devices (making those devices transparent). A film about foreigners, film making and foreign processes. Cast also includes: Ken Bolton, Mark Thomson and Tish Banks. Narrator: Richard Grayson.

results.title: The Flight of dragons
results.creator_credit: Arthur Rankin Jnr, Jules Bass and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.brief_description: Journey back to a magical time when the skies were filled with dragons in this feature-length animated version of Peter Dickinson’s acclaimed book. The tale is of the sinister Red Wizard Ommadon (James Earl Jones), who threatens to destroy nature. The world’s only hope is a man of science and magic from the future named Peter (John Ritter), snatched from the 20th century by the Green Wizard Carolinus (Harry Morgan) to capture Ommadon’s Red crown and thus take away his powers. Peter, accompanied by a fire-breathing dragon, an outlaw elf and a noble knight, applies modern-day logic to battling ancient evil.

results.title: The Ferals
results.creator_credit: David Evans, Wendy Gray and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: The Ferals are the original urban wild bunch. Rattus is tough, streetwise and constantly arguing with Modigliana, the cat with a definite sense of style, if not taste. With Mixy the rabbit and Derryn, the not too bright dog, they hang out in the shed at the bottom of Joe’s garden. “An explosion of talent”: The Feral’s performance at a talent quest is helped enormously by Leonard’s new invention - the Digital Volume Enhancer, until Modi pulls the wrong switch. “Double trouble”: As if one Rattus wasn’t trouble enough! Rattus and Joe’s ‘get-rich’quick’ scheme goes awfully wrong so it’s just as well that the Digital Duplicator has a reverse mode.

results.title: The Feeling of hostility
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the factors producing resentment and hostility in personal relationships. In the story of Clare we see how the death of her father and the later remarriage of her mother discouraged her from seeking affectional relationships with others. Although successful at college and in her business career, she feels the lack of fellowship and understanding. The factors behind this emotional inadequacy are reviewed by a psychiatrist. (Award: Toronto)

results.title: The First moving picture show
results.brief_description: A short claymation piece giving a unique perspective on early cinema. Plasticine models and simple drawings are combined with limited dialogue to show how pictures were made to move.

results.title: The First Christmas
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Van Blerk and XYZOO Animation
results.brief_description: Christopher Plummer narrates this delightful clay animation version of the story of the birth of Christ. Features traditional carols such as “Silent night”, “We three kings”, “O Come all ye faithful”, “O Little town of Bethlehem”, and “Joy to the world”. (Awards: Winner 1999 Andrew Carnegie Medal for Excellence in Children’s video)

results.title: The Final cut
results.creator_credit: Mike Vardy, Ken Riddington and BBC
results.brief_description: Urquhart is determined to remain in power longer than Margaret Thatcher but as that time approaches, his hold on the poltical ladder is not as firm. Tom Makepeace, the Foreign Secretary is likely to be his successor and is encouraged by his mistress to challenge the leadership. Urquhart’s past is threatening to overtake him but he and his wife are determined that his years as the Prime Minister will end in glory, not defeat. Ian Richardson is superb as Francis Urquhart in a compelling performance and this finale to the Urquhart story is both gripping and dramatic.

results.title: The Fiddlers of James Bay
results.creator_credit: Bob Rodgers, Mark Zannis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Scots from the Orkney Islands came to trade in Northern Quebec during the 17th century. They brought fiddles with them and introduced a new form of music to the Cree of James Bay. The music survived long after the Scots returned home. In this film two Cree fiddlers travel to the Orkney Islands, the birthplace of the music they learned from their fathers and grandfathers. The film captures the warmth and good will of this reunion.

results.title: The Feeling of rejection: its development and growth
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The case history of Margaret, a 23-year-old girl who has physical disorders with no physical causes. A psychiatrist shows her the root of her troubles—childhood overprotection and discouragement of her efforts to express herself, resulting in a crippling fear of failure and a complete inability to assert herself. When Margaret understands her problem, she develops new and healthier habits of behavior. (Awards: Chicago; Rome; Manila.) Produced for the Dept. of National Health and Welfare.

results.title: The FBI
results.creator_credit: George McCowan, Charles Larson, Quinn Martin, Seven Arts and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This television series screened between 1965 and 1975. Its production was endorsed by the Federal Bureau of Investigation with episodes based on actual FBI case files. Its emotionless portrayal of agents tracking down criminals provides a cool and compelling atmosphere. This episode called “Southwind” sees a banker escaping on a plane with two million dollars. Not only has he stolen money he has left gambling debts and a man injured in hospital. With no leads it is left to the methodical actions of the FBI agents to find the missing banker. This is a series where politics and drama meet as each episode was allegedly approved by J. Edgar Hoover himself. Cast includes Efrem Zimblist Jr., Philip Abbot and William Reynolds.
